Method Detail

setup

public void setup()
Initializes the datalink layer

isDiscovering

public boolean isDiscovering()
Returns:
whether a device discovery in ongoing

startApplication

public void startApplication()
Method to start the Protocol Handler. Starting is done by doing the following, - init the routing environment - creates & starts the packet listener - creates & starts the AODV msg listener - creates & starts the hello minder - creates and starts the RREQ ID minder

stopApplication

public void stopApplication()
Method to stop the protocol handler. Does this by stopping all the threads that were started start function and cleaning up the routing environment

getNeigbours

public long[] getNeigbours()
Returns:
a list of all neighbors

getAvailableDevices

public long[] getAvailableDevices()
Returns:
all entries in the routing table (excluding our own)

Returns:
the network address as long

Parameters:
s - the network error
Returns:
Slave (S), Master (M) or indirectly connected (X)

BroadcastRouteDown

public void BroadcastRouteDown(long dest)
Updates the seq num of the route to an odd number and sends that route immediatly to all neighbors. Should send also an updated route concerning all routes that have dest as next hop, update those to odd num as well and send

Parameters:
dest - the destination that is down

BroadcastRouteTableMessage

public void BroadcastRouteTableMessage()
Sends all active routes (routes with even seq nums) to all neighbors

BroadcastRouteTableMessageInstant

public void BroadcastRouteTableMessageInstant(java.util.Vector<RoutingTableEntry> routes)
Sends the supplied routes to all neighbors, used to send incremental updates as well as immediate changes

Parameters:
Vector - routes The vector of RoutingTableEntry objects to be sent

processDSDVRouteDownBroadcast

public void processDSDVRouteDownBroadcast(RouteBroadcastMessage rBroad)
Processes a Route Down message, this is sent when sending a packet detects a broken link/route

processDSDVMsgBroadcast

public void processDSDVMsgBroadcast(RouteBroadcastMessage rBroad)
DSDVBroadcast is a standard broadcast message used to send routing table information Processing this message requires going through all routes supplied in the package and analyze whether they are better than the known routes.

Parameters:
rBroad - A broadcast message received and forwarded

processDSDVMsgApplication

public void processDSDVMsgApplication(UniMessage appMsg)
Processes an Application message after receiving it from another device. Check whether message is intended for this device, if so then process else send on to next hop

Parameters:
appMsg - the message recieved

swap

public void swap(long dest)
Used to swap roles Master/Slave

Parameters:
dest - the destination address to swap with

public void breakConn(long dest)
Break a connection

Parameters:
dest - address to the device

public void printRouteTable()
Prints the routing table.

connect

public void connect(long dest)
Connect to an address

Parameters:
dest - the address to connect to

processMultiAppMessage

public void processMultiAppMessage(MultiAppMessage multiAppMessage)
A multicast message is recieved. If it is for me it is pushed upwards, and if there are more recievers that i have in my routing table

datalinkStatus

public void datalinkStatus(boolean datalinkStatus)
When the Bluetooth adapter has been initialized, the rest of the datalink can be initialized

Parameters:
datalinkStatus - inidicates whether the bluetooth adapater has been initialized
